name: GATRA Cyber SOC
description: GATRA (Guided Adaptive Threat Response Architecture) is an AI-driven Security Operations Center platform featuring five specialized agents that collaborate to detect anomalies, triage threats, contain incidents, enable continuous learning, and generate actionable reporting and visualizations.

skills.name: ADA — Anomaly Detection Agent
skills.description: Performs real-time anomaly detection on network traffic, endpoint telemetry, and SIEM events using multi-objective reinforcement learning. Identifies unusual patterns, zero-day indicators, and behavioral anomalies across the monitored infrastructure.
examples: Analyze recent network traffic for anomalous patterns
Scan endpoint telemetry for behavioral deviations
Detect zero-day indicators in the last 24 hours of SIEM events

skills.name: TAA — Triage & Analysis Agent
skills.description: Triages security alerts by correlating IOCs, enriching threat intelligence from multiple feeds (AbuseIPDB, ThreatFox, VirusTotal), mapping to MITRE ATT&CK techniques, and prioritizing incidents based on severity, asset criticality, and organizational context.
examples: Triage alert for suspicious outbound connection to 185.220.101.42
Correlate IOCs from phishing campaign with known threat actors
Map detected techniques to MITRE ATT&CK and assess kill chain stage

skills.name: CRA — Containment & Response Agent
skills.description: Executes incident containment and response actions including host isolation, IP blocking, account suspension, and playbook-driven remediation. Follows NIST 800-61 incident response framework with automated and analyst-approved response workflows.
examples: Block malicious IP addresses across perimeter firewalls

skills.name: CLA — Continuous Learning Agent
skills.description: Maintains the SOC knowledge base, tracks analyst feedback loops, updates detection models, generates post-incident reviews, and produces compliance/maturity assessments. Ensures the platform continuously improves detection accuracy and reduces false positive rates.
examples: Generate post-incident review for last week's ransomware response
Update detection models based on recent false positive feedback
Assess Zero Trust maturity across identity, network, and endpoint pillars

skills.name: RVA — Reporting & Visualization Agent
skills.description: Generates security dashboards, executive reports, trend analyses, and compliance documentation. Produces CII (Cyber Incident Index) scores, threat landscape summaries, and operational metrics for SOC leadership and stakeholders.
examples: Generate weekly SOC operations executive summary
Produce CII trend report for the APAC region
Create compliance status report for ISO 27001 controls

skills.name: IOC Scanner
skills.description: Performs real-time Indicator of Compromise lookups against multiple threat intelligence feeds including AbuseIPDB, ThreatFox, and VirusTotal. Supports IP addresses, domains, file hashes (MD5/SHA1/SHA256), and URLs.
examples: Look up IP address 45.33.32.156 across threat feeds
Check file hash a1b2c3d4e5f6 against known malware databases
Scan domain suspicious-site.example.com for threat indicators

apiKey.name: X-A2A-Key
apiKey.description: API key for A2A protocol authentication. Contact GATRA Research for access.
